title: Rimozione contatti su Thunderbird
content: Nel mio Thunderbird ho 5 rubriche con un totale di più di 3000 contatti, moltissimi ripetuti . Vorrei eliminarne un pò possibilmente "a blocchi" e non singolarmente . Riesco ad evidenziare i messaggi da eliminare ma non sono capace di eliminarli se sono più di uno. Come posso fare ? Grazie per i consigli che potrete fornirmi Virgilio
creator: virgilio.duchini

title: Problem when i press "ENTER"
content:
When I write an email and want to press Enter to jump down "ONE" line, and start a new sentence, it jumps down an extra line so it becomes a space. If I instead write all the time without pressing ENTER, it jumps down one line as usual and the text becomes coherent and nice.

I can't find a setting to avoid the problem of it jumping down double lines when ENTER is pressed.
creator: kymco250kxr

title: Change quotation level of text/quote in plain-text-compose editor
content:
See title – how can one change the indentation level of quoted text when working in the plain-text composer?

EDIT: By "indentation" I am referring to the "quotation level" of quoted emails I am responding too.
creator: jochen.kuepper

title: Kaspersky  Thunderbird  problem
content:
I have Kaspersky and Thunderbird. When i start Thunderbird i get this 'Kan inte garantera autenticiteten hos den domän till vilken en krypterad anslutning skapas ' and I do not understand how to get rid of it. It is a new fenomen.

Perhaps you can help us Regards Staffan Weinhardt Falsterbo sw458518@hotmail.com
creator: sw458518

title: Cannot see incomming or outgoing mail
content: I am unable to view incomming mail, outgoing mail arrives at its destination but cannot be viewed in sent folder.
creator: rjahart335

title: Thunderbird 115 pane resizing does not work well when switching between laptop screen and docked monitor
content:
I have been using and loving Thunderbird for a decade or so. I am using it with the "Vertical view" layout with three panes: 1) Folder pane (left; approx. 10%); 2) Message list pane (middle; approx. 40%); 3) Individual message pane (right; approx. 50%). I am using a laptop in a normal laptop mode with a Full HD screen when not in my office (meetings, home, traveling, etc.). However, in my office, the laptop is docked with a single Quad HD (2560x1440) monitor (laptop is closed). Since I am moving a lot around, I have to switch between the laptop screen (Full HD) and external monitor (Quad HD) many times a day.

So far, this has been no problem with Thunderbird. The panes got automatically adjusted to optimize display area use, so that the above ratios (10/40/50%) remained mostly unchanged. So the pane widths used up the same percentage of the screen width irrespective whether I was on the laptop screen or the large monitor.

When switching to Thunderbird 115 (Supernova), this has changed substantially. It seems Supernova apparently considers the width of the left (Folders) and right (Individual message) panes to be fixed and resizes only the middle (Message list) pane. Therefore, if I set the approx. 10/40/50% in Full HD and then switch to Quad HD, then I end up with a middle (Message list) pane much larger then needed, with a lot of empty space (see attachments). If I then readjust the pane sizes to the approx. 10/40/50% in Quad HD and then switch to Full HD (since I have to go to a meeting with my laptop, for example), then again only the middle (Message list) pane is resized (shrunk) and I end up with a message list with a lot of information missing/not visible.

The above issue forces me to constantly readjust the pane widths, which is quite frustrating. This has never happened in the previous versions of Thunderbird.

Any ideas about how to solve this issue would be much appreciated.
creator: mocsai

title: Rotating Color Ball & Hangups:  Help Please ?
content:
Hello,

Sorry to be a pest with this, but have always used Thunderbird, and this is driving mer crazy.

Always worked fine, until the last rev., or so.

Now, continually get that rotating colorful ball, usually forever.

Sometimes does go away after a minute or so, sometimes never. Never used to have this ball, and hangups.

What is going on, please ? Suggestions for having it work, again, as in the past which was perfect ?

Thanks, Bob
creator: rgsrose2

title: Constant outlook/hotmail accounts password request since thunderbird update
content: Since the last update of thunderbird the program keeps asking passwords over and over again from my multiple outlook/hotmail email accounts. Annoying and time consuming. The settings are all ok.
creator: rb_quebec

title: Outlook account cannot sign in using same details as logging in direct
content:
I have been unable to login using my main hotmail account using Thunderbird, I have checked both the password and the settings for Imap mail, they have not changed. I have reapplied the password in password manager, but it still says unable to login to read messages, please retry or enter password. I have tried safe mode and suspending extensions which has no effect. I can login to webmail on login.live.com using the same email address and password with no problem.

title: unifed inbox searches in 802 (sub-)folders
content:
Hi!

Probably since the last update, results from numerous (arbitrarily defined?) subfolders show up in my virtual folders.

Example: In the unified inbox I would expect - with six email accounts - emails from exactly six inbox folders. But in fact, emails from numerous subfolders of the respective inboxes appear there.

According to the unified inbox properties, there are exactly 802. I can't find a way to reset them all at once. After I had manually deactivated all 796 folders, they were there again after the next restart of Thunderbird. Deleting the "smart mailboxes" in the profile did not affect the behavior either.

Does anyone have a tip on how to get my unified inbox to display only the emails from the inbox folders of the different accounts and nothing else?

Thanks, Stephan
creator: stereiss

title: Automated answer only once per day
content: Hello, I'll be out of office for a month and I managed to setup an automated reply for my Thunderbird client. I would like it to send the automated reply only once per day for example, so that it doesn't not spam tons of absence messages... Is there a way to do this with Thunderbird? Thanks for your help, Best, Romain
creator: rlinares

title: Automatický podpis a základní formátování
content:
Dobrý den.

---

a) Automatický podpis

Při vložení automatického podpisu se mi nad podpis umístí dvě pomlčky "--". Automatický podpis je prováděn vložením HTML souboru obsahující potřebné formátování.

Prohledával jsem jak nastavení účtu kde se konfiguruje podpis, tak obecné nastavení, ale nedohledal jsem, jak nastavit, aby se nevkládaly tyto dvě pomlčky. Zkoušel jsem i různá nastavení HTML, ale bez úspěchu.

---

b) Základní formátování

Rád bych si nastavil jak použitý font (Verdana) a velikost textu (10px).

Nastavení fontu je OK, ale velikost lze nastavit pouze malá, střední, větší atd... Je možné někde vybírat z velikosti hodnoty, například 10, 12 atd...?

---

Pokud existuje možnost jednoduchého nastavení, rád se o tom dozvím. Pavel Cuc
creator: pcuc66

creator: gandrews

title: Folder colors in search folders, or: Automatically set tags based on folder name
content:
Hi all!

I'm using a Search Folder with all my messages of the last 30 days across several actual folders of my one-and-only IMAP account.

I already manually tagged all relevant messages in each folder, like: - Personal: Blue - Work: Red - Other: Gray

==> one tag for all messages per folder.

How can I have new incoming messages automatically tagged, based on the folder?

I know that I can create message filters, but the folder/location is not available as criteria, since it looks like the available criteria (subject, size, date, age, from, to, cc, custom header) all seem to work on message headers only; hence the "Folder" or "Location" criteria is missing (see screenshot).

Please note that my IMAP filter already has Sieve rules in place which take care of the filing into the right folder. I want to avoid replicating them as Thunderbird rules, as there are a few more than outlined above.

While there are some promising extensions, they all seem deprecated/too old for Thunderbird 115.

The "Filter SubFolders" Add-on is ancient and apparently comes closest to my intent. Quote:

" It turns out that there's already functionality to do filtering on sub folders in Thunderbird, it's just not well documented. It can be enabled by setting the preference "mail.server.default.applyIncomingFilters" to true, or can be applied per folder by setting the "applyIncomingFilters" property to a folder. FilterQuilla (https://addons.mozilla.org/en-us/thunderbird/addon/filtaquilla/) is reported to be able to set that property, although I haven't tested it. "

However, FilterQuilla also won't work with Thunderbird 115.

Any suggestions would be highly appreciated!
creator: james272

title: Thunderbird - Inbox does not automatically open at the point of the the  latest messages that have been downloadl.
content:
We are using the latest version of Thunderbird - 115.3.2 (64-bit).

Can we get the programmers to fix this problem?

When you open Thunderbird's Inbox - the cursor automatically goes to the middle of the messages that are in the inbox, which has messages that were downloaded several years ago.

Then, each time, you have to scroll to the bottom of the inbox to see the latest messages - which is a waist of time and effort.

Thunderbird's message box needs to open at the point of the latest messages that have been downloaded.

Version 115.3.2 (64-bit) does not do that.

title: Bug Report - Unable to Select Multiple Folders in Thunderbird Supernova 115.3.2
content:
Description: I would like to report a bug in the new version of Thunderbird, specifically in Thunderbird Supernova 115.3.2. In this version, it appears that I am unable to select multiple folders from the left panel simultaneously, which was a feature available in previous versions. For example, I used to be able to select the "Inbox" and "Sent" folders at the same time, allowing me to perform various actions on them simultaneously. This functionality has been essential for my workflow, and its absence in the new version is causing significant inconvenience.

Steps to Reproduce:

  1. Launch Thunderbird Supernova 115.3.2.
  2. Navigate to the left panel where your list of folders is displayed.
  3. Attempt to select multiple folders simultaneously, such as "Inbox" and "Sent."

Expected Behavior: In previous versions of Thunderbird, I was able to select multiple folders from the left panel and perform actions on them, such as marking them as read/unread.

Actual Behavior: In Thunderbird Supernova 115.3.2, I am unable to select multiple folders from the left panel. Only one folder can be selected at a time, which makes it impossible to perform certain actions on multiple folders simultaneously.

This change in behavior is causing a significant disruption to my workflow, as I frequently need to work with multiple folders at once. I kindly request that this feature be reinstated.

Additional Information: 

   Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 10.0.19045    Thunderbird Version: Thunderbird Supernova 115.3.2    This issue was not present in previous versions of Thunderbird.    This issue affects my productivity and ability to efficiently manage my email accounts.

Please let me know if there are any additional details or information needed to address this bug effectively. I hope this report can help in resolving the issue and improve Thunderbird's usability in the future.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

John.
creator: zrrmqrkkp

title: Move title bar bar to the top in latest version
content: I just got updated to the latest version 115.3.1 and the menu bar has been moved to below the toolbar. I find this confusing and very annoying since this is different from the way all other windows apps are set up and changes the way I'm used to working with Thunderbird. I want the menu bar moved back to the top but I can't find any way to do this. The Customize option is mentioned in the three bar menu but that option doesn't exist either. Please help. Thanks, Doug Sundquist

title: Emails on Server
content: I installed Thunderbird but also use Outlook. When I open Thunderbird it downloads emails from the server. If I leave the message in my Inbox and then open Outlook will Outlook also download the email into my Outlook Inbox? In other words, are the emails retained on the server so I can download them via different email clients? And if I delete an email from Thunderbird Inbox is it still on the server in case I delete it by mistake and want to re-download it off the server again? Thanks

creator: jay10

title: Filters not finding valid folders
content:
Thunderbird version 115.3.1 (64-bit) running on Windows 10 Professional.

Since resetting the operating system on both my computers and installing Thunderbird from scratch, I have been having a problem with filters receiving the following message.

“The folder ‘xyz’ could not be found, so filter(s) associated with this folder will be disabled. Verify that the folder exists, and that filters points to a valid destination folder”

Thunderbird comes up randomly, saying that the folder the filter is trying to move the messages to is not found. I edit the filter and re-select the given folder from the list of folders, and this resolves the problem.

However, this keeps coming up randomly; a given filter would work for a while but will return with the error.

I found a message on the Internet mentioning the following:

"The Mozilla ISP database, for some reason, is returning the "imap.gmail.com" server name when the account is configured in Thunderbird. Manually configure it to be "imap.googlemail.com," and the filters work just fine."

I tried this "solution," but it has not helped.

Has anyone else encountered this problem, and if so, is there a solution?

I will greatly appreciate your feedback.

Mike.
creator: MikeMV

title: Weird font size after update
content:
So I updated my Thunderbird around October 13 2023 and I currently have version 115.3.2.

I use a 4K monitor and after the update the upper pane (where the message list appears) has really tiny font and all the rows seem so close together that they are really hard to read or scroll through.

I have used the 'View-->Font Size' option but it increases all the fonts in Thunderbird literally everywhere and also makes them really thick.

When I go to 'Tools-->Settings-->Language & Appearance' and change from the default calibri 17 to calibri 22, nothing changes. The fonts stay the same.

Is there a way to make the fonts or line spacing less compressed. Making a screenshot doesn't really show 100% how I see this in real life (way smaller) but it is really hard to read. The image below shows unread messages (bold) but once I go to a mailbox with read messages, they are so thin and small that the font appears gray, hardly visible.

Can I download the previous version somewhere? Before October 2023?

title: Any plans for improvements to email formatting functionality?
content: Hi, I just got the latest Thunderbird update. The new features are all very nice, but what I've really been waiting for for the many years I've been using Thunderbird is improvements to the email formatting (rich text / html) functionality. Though I prefer Thunderbird for everyday use, when I really want control of the formatting of an outgoing email with minimal frustration, I switch over to MS Outlook. Are there any plans for improvements in this area?
creator: bleviton

title: Email Access Problems
content: Happily using Google as a browser, GMAIL.com and Thunderbird (TB) for emails. Just switched computer on and clicked on TB only to receive an totally unsolicited TB upgrade to Super Nova (SN) which immediately self loaded onto my computer. As an unexplained, unexpected and unwelcome result, Google then set itself up as the Authenticator of my account and requiring me to now Sign in to my account, which it has immediately rejected each time and resulted in me, on 3 separate occassions, being informed by Google that my account had been recovered, with the present position now being that I have lost access my emails, with a Google advisement that my Google account is now "malformed" and "That's all they know". Further mystery is that Inexplicably it has not affected the Gmail.com version on my phone as I can still send and receive emails. Also, and I have absolutely no understanding of why?, but for some reason Norton has also decided to self load itself on to my computer as a browser, instead of solely as Antivirus protection. In short, as I now totally bereft of possible solutions, I would be grateful if anyone could suggest how to uninstall the Super Nova upgrade while retaining my emails accounts and information, do I have to Uninstall Google and Norton prior to reinstalling both? Any suggestions would be warmly and speedily welcomed especially if they entail causing minimum further disruption
creator: macdonaldlouis3

title: Thunderbird stopped receiving emails addressed to our yahoo mail accounts on 10/05/23, but still get gmail
content: Thunderbird stopped receiving emails from our yahoo accounts on 10-05-23 but still receives mail to gmail account. Can send from yahoo accounts and recipient receives them but the messages do not show up in thunderbird "sent" folder.

title: Turning off threading in Ctrl+Shift+F method of Search
content:
Hi,

Recently, a Thunderbird update seemed to have turned on Threading of displayed messages across my folders. I was able to turn it off, no problem.

However, it also turned on threading in my Search Results and that still remains. I cannot find a way to turn it off there.

Note: I open the Search window by clicking on Edit > Find > Search Messages, otherwise known as Ctrl+Shift+F.

Note: I am NOT talking about Ctrl-K or any other method for which the posted Community solutions do not work.

How can I turn off threading in the Search results when using the method of Ctrl+Shift+F ?

Thank you.
creator: seattleuser

title: Help with configuring Thunderbird.  How to leave messages on IMAP server?
content: As it stands, messages are downloaded to TB after I connect and the IMAP server side is deleted, no messages remain. I cannot remember why this happens, but I now want all messages to remain on the server even when I dl locally to TB. Thanks

title: Avast flags faulty certificate on my webemail server Shaw Cable Systems (now Rogers)
content: hello, I just decided to allow my pet (favourite) laptop online after many years of using it only offline and so downloaded the latest Thunderbird so that I can read email ... but though I was using TB on another (older, Windows 7 Home) laptop earlier this evening, I can't get the newer one (Windows 10 pet) past a certificate flaw Avast has found and don't know enough to click the permission box or the "permanent" permissions box. Is it just that one has Avast and the other has Kaspersky? and Kaspersky doesn't have the same strictures? thanks if you can reassure me... I can't see anything wrong with anything visible in the certificate but in bold type it says that no reputable bank, store or other public entity would ever have a certificate in the condition this one apparently is in. Not sure what to do ... thanks for any help.
creator: filterfeeder
